contained.title: type
contained.description: Type of party, such as  `PERSON`,  `ORGANISATION`, etc. Role name, e.g.  general practitioner ,  nurse ,  private citizen . Taken from inherited `_name_` attribute.

name: PARTY
title: PARTY
description:
Ancestor of all Party types, including real world entities and their roles. A Party is any entity which can participate in an activity. The `_name_` attribute inherited from `LOCATABLE` is used to indicate the actual type of party (note that the actual names, i.e. identities of parties are indicated in the `_identities_` attribute, not the `_name_` attribute).

NOTE: It is strongly recommended that the inherited attribute `_uid_` be populated in `PARTY` objects, using the UID copied from the `_object_id()_` of the `_uid_` field of the enclosing `VERSION` object. +
For example, the `ORIGINAL_VERSION.uid` `87284370-2D4B-4e3d-A3F3-F303D2F4F34B::uk.nhs.ehr1::2`  would be copied to the `_uid_` field of the `PARTY` object.

constraint.human: Identities valid must not be empty

constraint.expression: relationships.exists() implies (relationships.empty().not() and then relationships.for_all (r | r.source = self)

constraint.human: Reverse relationships validity must be present
constraint.expression: reverse_relationships.exists() implies (reverse_relationships.empty().not() and then reverse_relationships.for_all (item | repository (\"demographics\").all_party_relationships.has_object (item) and then repository(\"demographics\").all_party_relationships.object (item).target = self))
